introduction.purpose: This document provides a detailed summary and guidance for describing drug disintegration images across eight key dimensions. The goal is to enhance accuracy, clarity, and context when describing drug disintegration processes.

dimensions.name: Color Change
dimensions.description: Captures the variations in color intensity, transparency, and spatial distribution during drug disintegration.

dimensions.name: Shape Change
dimensions.description: Tracks the overall transformation of the drug's shape from intact to fragmented.

dimensions.name: Surface Texture Change
dimensions.description: Describes changes in surface texture, including roughness, cracking, and pore formation.

dimensions.name: Volume Change
dimensions.description: Monitors the reduction in tablet size, correlating with its disintegration rate.

dimensions.name: Dissolution Speed and Time
dimensions.description: Captures dynamic changes in dissolution rate and particle formation over time.

dimensions.name: Physical State Change
dimensions.description: Documents the internal and external structure changes, including cracking, swelling, and collapse.

dimensions.name: Dissolution Medium
dimensions.description: Explores the influence of medium characteristics such as pH, surfactants, and viscosity on disintegration.

dimensions.name: Fragment Distribution with Density
dimensions.description: Tracks fragment distribution and density in the dissolution medium, including movement and sedimentation.

introduction.objective: Each dimension includes specific criteria, examples, and detailed suggestions to ensure consistent, vivid, and thorough descriptions, supporting both qualitative and quantitative analysis.
